conversations.content: Hey there, Nina.
Well, if it isn't my favorite customer! What can I do you for today?
Some dragonfruit and holy water, please. Oh, and then...
Thanks for waiting! This is everything you ordered, right?
Looks good. Thanks as always, Nina.
The thanks are all mine. I'm so grateful to have a regular customer like you!
Well, your store carries everything, and the quality is all top-shelf.
We've been able to keep up the long fight because we have you in our corner.
I'm honored that I could have been of service—and I've heard hundreds of stories about all the great work you do!
I even hear you've been out to North Grastaea lately? What's it like up there?
Well, it's different from here in a lot of ways, but Grams is definitely quite a deal.
The gorgeous cityscape is overwhelming, of course, but the culture and values of the people are what really make it special.
Er, what do you mean by ＂culture and values＂?
Well, the Ilian Church has an extremely strong presence there, to the point where it's involved with both politics and the people's daily lives.
Seriously?! I had no idea...
Er, or that's how it USED to be, anyway. The city was basically leveled a little while ago when Satan... Well, it's a long story—and a sad one too.
Ah, right. That must be all the chatter I keep hearing about our taking in refugees here in Alberia.
Yeah, I'm glad that worked out, because fiends have been going berserk all over North Grastaea ever since the city fell.
I guess that means it's dangerous for people to travel to the north, huh?
Yeah. It's been rough stuff, and I suspect it's only going to become an even fiercer battle moving forward.
We've got people staying to protect the Halidom and other people making the expeditions to the north, so we're stretched thin when it comes to fighters.
Stretched thin, eh?
I have a request!
What's that?
Weeell...
Bwa ha ha ha! This here must be the Nina Shop what we keep hearin' about!
Hooo-eee! We're gonna make us some serious coin in this joint!
Ah, customers. Sorry, but we'll have to return to this once they're done.
Welcome, gents! What can I do you for?
We, uh...got somethin' we need. Think ya can do that?
Getting people what they need is our bread and butter! So what is it?
ALL THE MONEY YA GOT!
Ack!
Stop right there, thieves!
Don't move a muscle, you straw-haired puke, unless ya want yer next purchase to be a coffin for the shopmiss here!
Hrk...
Now make with the cash, little lady, and do it snappy!
Yeah, I don't think so.
The hell did ya just say?!
The Nina Shop has a longstanding policy of greeting all customers with a smile... with three exceptions.
Customers with unreasonable complaints, customers who shoplift...and customers who try to rob me!
I'm not giving you people anything! Not a single thing on the shelves, and not one single rupie—so you can make like a lousy scout and get lost!
BWAAA HA HA HA!
Lady, have you EVER heard of a bandit what just up and agrees to vamoose the moment someone says boo to 'im?
Well, I tried.
But gentlemen, there are two ways you can leave this store: on your feet... OR ON YOUR STUPID BUTTS!
Uh, Nina?! I don't think these are the kind of guys you want to mess with!
Oh it's fine. I can fight now. I have the power of...
RUPIEEEE MAAAAGIC!
WHAT'N THE SWEET HELL?!
I had no idea you knew magic, Nina— and such powerful magic to boot!
Uh, but what is ＂rupie magic,＂ exactly?
Why, I'm glad you asked! Rupie magic is a legendary form of magic that awakens in those merchants who have made lots and lots and LOTS of the ol' cashola!
We can draw out the power hiding in rupies and use it as magic!
Rupies...have power?
Think about it! Every time something is bought or sold, rupies change hands. Before you know it, they've traveled all over the whole darn world!
And mana—the source of magic—ALSO travels around the world. You could say the fundamental nature of rupies and mana is the same!
Uh...I hear the words you're saying, but I'm having trouble making sense of them in that particular order.
Anyway, I can fight now is the point.
As such, you have to let me join you guys!
You want to join us? Like, JOIN join us?
Yeah! That's actually what I was going to talk to you about right before those two booger-faces walked in here.
I've always been really interested in North Grastaea.
See, I inherited the shop from my dad, which made me a business owner at a pretty early age. But as a result, I haven't had many chances to really travel.
And I'd bet rupies to donuts that if I had more chances to go to new places I don't know much about, I could grow as a merchant!
Plus, I think my rupie magic would make me a real asset in your pocketbook, so to speak. So if you're heading north soon, I'd like you to take me with you!
Well, this isn't the conversation I was expecting to have today, but I can't deny that your rupie magic has a real kick.
Still, why are you so keen on heading to North Grastaea? Surely there are less- dangerous places you could visit?
Because, uh...I want to test my skill! And if I can fight in a dangerous place, I'll know I can safely do business myself going forward.
In that case, the next time we go north, I'll be sure to let you know.
Really?! Yahoo! Thanks so much, Prince Euden!
Oh, just Euden is fine. We're comrades-in-arms now, after all.
Bit of a leap to go from ＂my favorite customer＂ to ＂prince＂ to just a name, but if that's what you want, I'll try!
That's all I ask. It'll be great to have you fighting alongside us, Nina. Thank you!
You betcha, Euden!
I'll be sure to prove how helpful I can be as one of your comrades!
Welcome to North Grastaea, Nina.
Wait, what?! But we were JUST back in the Halidom!
This is bananas! And grapes! Both of 'em! I mean, this could absolutely revolutionize the distribution of goods!
How have we not set up these teleporter thingies up all over Alberia already?
Unfortunately, we can't. The teleportation  ability comes from a jewel that Alberius left behind.
Well, that's a kick in the britches.
This guy thought the same thing at first. I mean, it'd be so handy to just pop from one place to another like that, yeah?
But nothin' is easy in this hard old world, so shuffle them feet and let's finish the trip with some honest walkin'!
We're off to Valzgald, the biggest trade hub in North Grastaea!
There! Haaaah!
Daaaayum, Nina! That rupie magic is no joke!
So the more ya earn, the stronger it gets? Sounds made up, but I guess I gotta believe since I just saw ya do it.
Still, that was some serious power. Just how much HAVE ya earned?
Hee hee! I'm afraid I can't reveal company secrets, my good man.
That just makes me wanna know MORE!
They're coming back around, everybody! Don't let your guard down!
You just let your buddy Luca take this one. Nina's magic is great and all, but I'm no slouch myself!
And what kinda merc would I be if I let some merchant do all the fightin'?!
Aw yeah! That's the good stuff!
Mess with the bull, and you get the Luca and Ranzal horns!
Gya! Look out! There was another one hiding behind that rock!
Crap! We're too slow!
Watch out, you two! Haaah!
Phew! Appreciate it, Nina. You're a real life-saver.
Aw, no worries. We'll just say you owe me one!
Uh oh. Now that's scary. You know merchants never forget a tab.
Heh. Well, in any event, I'm glad that the two of you are okay.
Let's keep moving. We're almost there.
I can't believe I'm actually standing in the biggest trade hub in North Grastaea!
And my dad's...
Something wrong, Nina?
Oh, sorry. I was just, um...so moved that I was speechless.
Say, Euden? If we're gonna be here for a while, you mind if I go poke around?
I want to check out the city and make some notes for future reference.
Of course. If you need anything, I'll be talking with the head of the city about a potential exchange with Alberia.
We'll have things settled in about three days, so let's meet back here then.
Gotcha. See you in three days!
All righty, time to scope out the local shops and take in the vibes.
Huh? Why is a sunny orange THIS pricey? It's three times more than in the south!
Maybe it's the difference in climate?
Oranges are hard to grow in colder climates, and the smaller the harvest, the higher the price rises, which means...
I smell a business opportunity! ...'Scuse me! Shopkeep!
What can I do for you, miss?
Why is this sunny orange so expensive?
Uh...because it's valuable? You won't find a lower price anywhere in town, if that's what you're wondering.
(I knew it!)
Okay, so I'm actually a merchant visiting from South Grastaea.
If you want, I can introduce you to my sunny orange supplier from the south.
That would be wonderful! ...Er, assuming you don't intend to bleed off all my profits as the middleman, that is.
Not at all! I'm hoping we can have a long and fruitful relationship, so I'll make it cheap.
However, I WOULD like to pick your brain about the state of goods distribution here in the north...
Three days later...
Well, that's all the business taken care of. Time to head back south.
You got it, Euden!
Well, you're certainly in some high spirits. I take it you had a good time in the city?
Couldn't have been better!
I had just the BEST time, and I'm so dang happy I asked you to let me come along.
And I ALSO fell into a business opportunity that's gonna lead to some sweet, sweet rupies in the very near future.
Bwa ha ha! Look at this kid go! She can't even stop bein' a merchant on vacation!
Right? But hey, since we owe you a debt, maybe we can pay it back by helping your shop rake in the mad coin!
A debt...? Wait, are you talking about when I helped you guys during that fight?
Yeah! I know I gotta pay you back, so when we get back to South Grastaea, I'm gonna help your shop get up and running!
You can count ol' Ranzal in on that too. Bein' in debt to a merchant seriously weighs on the ol' brainpan.
Uh...but no! I mean, I know I said you'd ＂owe me one,＂ but you really don't have to do—
Nope! Deal's done! You just leave it to us.
Rupie magic gets stronger the more you earn, so once we help yer shop start rakin' in the dough, you'll be blastin' chumps in the face like an old pro!
What?! Wait, no!
Uh, but don't ya WANT yer rupie magic what to get powered up?
Yes, but it's... I mean... That's a very generous offer. Thank you both.
Then it's settled! When we get back, we'll get right to helping!
All right, bud! Time to power up Nina's rupie magic, so let's get out there and shout ourselves hoarse until everybody in town comes runnin' to her shop!
Heck yeah! We'll get so many customers in this place that it brings down the house! Uh, metaphorically, of course.
I, uh... Look, I don't know if you need to attack it with QUITE so much fervor...
HEAR YE, HEAR YE! Get yer butts over to the Nina Shop, where we got the finest selection this side'a Alberia! If she ain't stockin' it, you don't need it!
Hoy there, friend! Need some healin'? One drop'a this killer salve will have any wound healed up faster than ya can say ＂I love the Nina Shop more'n my own kids＂!
ANY wound?! That's incredible!
Well, I mean, I wouldn't try to reattach an arm with it or nothin', but for cuts and scrapes, yer sittin' pretty as a jaybird!
Soooo...it's just medicine? Thanks, but I've got plenty of that already.
What are you doing, beef-for-brains?! Lemme show you how it's done!
Welcome one and all, to the Nina Shop, where our goods are always affordable! In fact, for a limited time only, everything in the store is HALF PRICE!
HALF PRICE?!
That's right, friend! Why, you'd need a broadsword to slash these prices further! Now if you'll just step this—
Luca, you dope! If ya drop the price on everything by half, poor Nina's gonna lose her shirt AND her pants!
Oh crap! I didn't even think about math! Uhhh, sorry, folks! Got a bit ahead of myself there! It's actually a 30-percent-off sale! Or, um...maybe 20?
Do you even KNOW your prices?
This seems suspicious. I'm leaving.
The Nina Shop, is it...?
Excuse me, but is the shopkeeper Nina available at the moment?
You're the head of the merchant's guild! What can I do for you today?
Well, it's about your barkers. I'm afraid they've stepped over the line from mere exuberance to outright lies and being a general nuisance to the community.
THEY DID WHAT?!
...We're so ashamed.
*sigh* I'm just glad the guild head noticed before you two did something stupid. ...Er, or stupid-ER, I suppose.
False advertising and vague pricing are both slick roads down a long hill to losing your customer's confidence.
Had you two kept it up, my shop's reputation would've been in the gutter.
We're really sorry...but we know what we did wrong now! Give us another chance!
Yeah! We wanna bust our humps to help make yer rupie magic stronger!
Oh, enough already about that! I mean, the rupie magic is just...
Is what?
Uh...nothing. Anyway, I really don't need your help with the shop any more.
*sigh* I should have expected you two chowderheads to cause nothing but heartburn for poor Nina.
Seems like our wisdom is needed!
Well, if it isn't the peddler and the rupie- pinching mercenary from the Halidom! What are you two doing here?
Prince Euden asked us to drop by and help Ranzal and Luca out if... Well, if what happened happened.
He...did? Oh, boy. This whole thing is starting to balloon out of control...
Er, you look distraught. Something wrong?
Oh, er, no! Nothing at all! Ha ha...haaaaa.
Aw, are you nervous? Not to worry! Irfan and I put our heads together and came up with a money-making scheme that's SURE to succeed!
If you do exactly as we say, even Ranzal and Luca will be able to contribute to the store's prosperity.
Thanks, pal! Always lookin' out!
So what kind of plan is it? C'mon, tell us! We'd do anything to help!
Aaaanything...? Good, because that's going to make this go a LOT faster.
So all we need from you two...is blood.
Mommy, look! What's everybody crowded around over there for?
Why, it looks like a street performance. Let's take a look, shall we?
Greetings to you all, fellow citizens! Please, gather round! Don't be shy!
Behold as the greatest archer in the land, Luca, shoots this apple held in my hand!
I aim, and three...two...one...FIIIIIRE!
Voila! The apple is split clean in two!
OOOOOO! AAAAAAAH!
Uh...oh no! Egads!
Oh dear! It seems I have pierced the hand of my good and true friend, Ranzal!
I'm afraid ya did, old chum... but not to worry!
A wound like this ain't nothin' so long as I got this medicine from the Nina Shop! With just one application...
Behold! My hand's better'n before!
The wound is gone?! That's some truly incredible medicine!
Sure is, pal—and you good folks can buy all ya can hold over at the Nina Shop!
Hey! This isn't a street performance— it's an advertisement!
Who cares WHAT it is? That medicine just glued the man's hand back together!
I want some, Mommy! Pleeeeease?!
Well, I suppose you are always roughhousing, so maybe we'll buy some to keep in the cabinet, just in case.
Boy, I tell you what, that plan Irfan and Francesca came up with was a WINNER.
Who woulda ever thought to put fake blood inside an apple to make me seem injured?
As the days went by, Ranzal and Luca went all about town giving product demonstrations to great success, and customers began flooding the Nina Shop in search of her famous medicine.
This place is hoppin' like a rabbit convention in a sugar factory!
Nina's rupie magic is sure to get a huge power boost now!
Uuuuurgh... Umm...
Er, you don't look very happy about all of this, Nina.
Wh-what? No, I mean... Um...
Oh boooy! I'm soooo happy! I can feel such awesome power emanating from all the rupies I'm earning!
Well, that's what's important— plus, now our debt's been repaid!
Welp, have a good one, Nina! We're looking forward to having your help again in the future!
Rupie magic...
Let's see, today's sales are...
Oh! I finally hit my goal! I think this means my dream will be able to come true!
This happened faster than I thought— and there's no denying it's due to the big influx of money that came in today.
Ranzal and Luca—and everyone else in the Halidom—all worked so hard to help and support me.
Nina's rupie magic is sure to get a huge power boost now!
Oh, geez. This is just making it harder to tell them the truth...
I just sort of blurted out the whole ＂rupie magic＂ thing, but the truth is...
My power comes from this magical tool!
Let's go, everyone!
Yeah!
(He said they were heading north again, and I've found myself along with them.)
(So what do I do? I mean, telling them I was making up rupie magic after all they did for me is just so...awkward.)
Nina? You're sort of staring off into space. Everything okay?
Huh? Oh yeah, I'm good! I can fight!
(Okay. For now, I just need to fight and prove that I won't be a burden.)
Haaaah!
Impressive stuff, lady—but I bet that's just the beginning for you, huh?
Yeah, let's see that beefed-up rupie magic!
Er, right! You got it!
(They're all expecting it, so I need to make it look like the magic got powered up.)
(I REALLY wish I hadn't said all that stuff about it getting stronger the more you earn, but there's nothing for it now.)
Yah! Hah! Haaah!
Whoooa! You mopped up that bunch of fiends before I could blink!
Uh, well...it's all because of the extra power you helped me earn!
Look lively, everybody! This one's no joke.
Aw, we've got nothing to worry about with Nina the Killer on our side!
No lies there. Now go give 'em the ol' rupie razzle, Nina!
The ol'...rupie razzle... Uh, right! Haaah!
(Shoot! I need to squeeze more power out of my magical device!)
(Oh geez, it's getting really hot!)
EEEK!
Nina!
Oh man! It looks like whatever Nina was holding there just blew up!
It exploded while she was tryin' to gather up mana!
Hang on. Nina, did all of your magic actually come from that device?
BUH?!
Oh, er... Well, you see...
Oh geez. Heeeelp!
Hold on, Nina! We're coming!
Right!
Haaah!
That fiend was ten pounds'a angry in a two-pound sack, but we managed to take it out.
You all right, Nina?
Um, yeah. I suppose.
Good. But, um, did your magic actually come from that thing you were holding earlier? The one that blew up?
Yeah, it did. And before you ask, also yes. I...I made up rupie magic.
But why would you make up something like that?!
Because I wanted to join up with you!
But I thought you'd tell me I'd just be in the way because I couldn't fight, so...
Why were you so determined to join us?
Because it's my dream—one I inherited from my dad along with the shop.
See, Dad was born in North Grastaea, but the ravages of war drove him south.
He'd always dreamed of opening a shop in his hometown, and I wanted to make it happen. For him, you know?
That explains your fixation on the north.
Yep. So when I heard what you were doing up there, it gave me an idea.
I figured if I could hitch a ride up there with you guys, I might finally be able to put Dad's plan into motion.
And it worked! I was able to make some professional connections in Valzgald, which was his hometown.
One thing led to another, and eventually I took ownership of an empty storefront.
Sounds like your dream is pretty close to becoming a reality.
Yeah—and thanks to Luca and Ranzal and all the rest of you, I earned enough money to actually open the second store!
I've wanted to apologize for tricking you— I really, REALLY did—but I just couldn't find a way to say it. I'm really sorry.
But you didn't trick us, Nina! I mean, sure, your power came from somewhere else, but it was still power, and we owed you that debt fair and square.
Ain't no skin off my nose helping a friend fulfill a dream.
Thank you both. I don't think you'll ever know how much you did for me.
I couldn't have said it better, Nina. And congrats on your grand opening!
Thank you so much!
Oh, and by way of apology, please let me stick with you all for a little longer! Once I fix up my magic device, I'll be able to help you all out again.
I'm sorry, Nina, but we can't do that.
Even if you do fix your magical tool, what if it blows up again? You'd be in serious danger if that ever happened.
Um, well... Yeah, I guess I don't really have anything I can say to that.
I'm glad you understand. And with that, we need to get going.
We'll keep you protected until we get back to Alberia, so don't worry about a thing.
R-right. Sure. Sorry for the trouble...
(So this is how it ends...)
(It's like I just ended up using all of them for the sake of my dream.)
(And sure, they forgave me, but I still feel just awful about everything...)
And so now I put this here aaaand... Okay-doke! I think that did it!
With everything finally prepped, I now declare the long-awaited second branch of the Nina Shop open for business!
It's the new store I dreamed of opening... and the one I deceived all my friends in order to acquire.
Still, I gotta do my best. If I don't bust my hump to make it a roaring success, I'll never be able to face them again.
And speaking of momentous occasions, it's my first customer! Welcome to the North Grastaea branch of the Nina Shop!
I...I need medicine! Please, give me all you have! My companion is badly hurt!
What?! That's terrible! Hold on, let me grab it!
Thank you! My friend is at the inn, so please come with me!
It looks like your medicine helped.
I'm glad. But how was he injured in the first place?
We were traveling in the wilds when a fiend showed up. We tried to fight back, but it was just too strong.
Just when I thought we were done for, some passers-by showed up to help and we managed to escape with our lives.
They were truly kind souls—I think their leader went by ＂Euden＂?
Did you say Euden?!
Oh, you know him?
I sure do. Also, helping a total stranger he happens to be passing by is SERIOUSLY on point for him.
Anyway, don't worry about a thing. They're stronger than dirt, so I'm sure they've got that fiend all wrapped up.
I hope you're right, because that was the toughest fiend I'd ever seen.
Er, really? How so?
It had an unusually thick hide—my blade couldn't even dent the thing!
If your friends aren't as tough as you say, they're probably in a world of hurt right about now.
No way...
(Oh geez, what should I do? I'm worried about my friends, but without my magical device, I don't know if I can even help.)
(Okay, calm down, Nina. They've survived tons of dangerous battles before this, so they don't need you trying to save the day.)
(In fact, this same thing happened back when I met Euden...)
The Dyrenell Empire is requisitioning all the goods in this shop! Rejoice and be honored that you are granted the chance to aid our great nation!
Stop it, you goons!! My business will go down the outhouse if you take everything!
Back then, South Grastaea was in chaos due to the Dyrenell Empire. Real customers had fled, and the imperial soldiers were utter tyrants. The poor Nina Shop was in real trouble.
Leave that shopkeeper alone!
And then, a gallant figure appeared and saved me.
I know things are tough, but just hold out a little longer. I'm going to bring happiness back to this land—I promise!
And just as he said, he and his friends fought the Other and his empire and defeated them both.
And then, thanks to his regular business, my shop got out of the rut it was in and was able to prosper.
(You know, when I think about it, the prince is ALWAYS helping me out.)
(Not only did he create a foothold for me in the north, he's been patronizing my store all this time!)
(He's basically my hero—and if my hero is in danger, then gosh darn it, I'm gonna get out there and help!)
Take me to the place you were attacked!
I have to go there right now! I have to help Euden!
Help him? Aren't you a merchant?
Yep, and that is precisely how I'm gonna help. I've got GOODS, baby!
The Nina Shop has all of the hottest must-have items for both your travel AND fiend-slaying needs!
Hraaah!
This thing's tougher than a week-old steak!
I'm sorry, but my mana is exhausted...
This doesn't look good...
Hey, do you guys hear that?! It sounds like a cart!
Everybody okay?!
Nina?! What are you doing here?!
We'll chat later! First, healing!
I loaded this cart up with medicine and tons of other useful goodies.
Think of it as a ＂Bleeding Profits＂ sale. Now take what you need, free of charge!
Holy crap, you are a LIFESAVER!
Oh yeah, come to Papa... YOINK! Here ya go, boss!
This should be enough to keep me going!
This elixir should help you, Cleo!
Oh, but this is incredible! I feel mana surging back into my body!
And now I've got a little something for that fiend... IT'S CLOSING TIME, CREEP!
What was that, Nina?
It's a salve used for tanning leather that should soften up that tough hide.
IT'S TIME TO THUMP A CHUMP! OOOH YEAAAH!
Hot diggity dog! The hide's still tough, but at least we can hurt the damn thing!
Come on everyone! All-out attack!
Haaaaah!
Permit me to finish it off! Haaah!
Yesss! We won!
And we couldn't have done it without Nina.
But how did you know we were in trouble in the first place?
Oh, well...
So that fella we helped out hightailed it right to yer shop, eh?
Wait. So ALL the tools and potions we just used were goods from your new store?!
Oh man, we went through that stuff like it was going outta style! You're gonna be ruined! RUINED, I TELLS YA!
Well, I'm definitely going to have to push the grand opening back a bit.
I'm sorry your dream is being put on hold because you helped us, Nina.
Aw, don't even worry about it.
I'll restock the store and have it open within a fortnight—count on it!
Plus I was just thinking about this earlier, but you're my hero!
A true merchant never forgets a debt, and this is the least I can do for a hero.
Well, you helped us out of a real jam, so thank you again.
No thanks required! Buuuut, I might bug you for a teensy little favor if it's okay...
Please promise to drop in at the second branch of the Nina Shop whenever you're in North Grastaea, okay?
That's not a favor, Nina—I was already planning to do that anyway!
Really?! Oh, that's so great!
Well, let me thank you in advance for your business at the Nina Shop, where you always get service with a smile!
